hypothesis_content.title: Meme Coin Volatility Contagion to Majors
hypothesis_content.statement: An extreme volatility event in a high-profile meme coin (DOGE or PEPE)—defined as a >50% intraday price range—during a NEUTRAL or early BULL regime will spill over, causing a statistically significant increase in the 2-day realized volatility of major large-cap altcoins (SOL, AVAX) but NOT necessarily BTC.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Meme coin mania acts as a sentiment and liquidity probe. Extreme moves capture market-wide attention, increase trader activity, and force leverage adjustments across connected books. This hyperactivity and sentiment shift contagion flows first to other speculative altcoins before potentially affecting the core BTC market.
entry_conditions: Regime == NEUTRAL or (BULL with SPX 5-day change < 2%)
Event occurs between 06:00-18:00 UTC (core trading hours)
Aggregate meme coin sector volume > 150% of its 10-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: For a derived pairs trade: Short volatility (sell options) on the meme coin / Long volatility (buy options) on SOL/AVAX after the initial spike, targeting a volatility spread reversion over 3 days.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: For derived trade: Stop if BTC 1-day range exceeds 6% (market-wide stress overrides).
exit_conditions.time_exit: Close derived trade 72 hours after entry.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Following the meme coin volatility event, the average 2-day realized volatility of SOL and AVAX is not significantly higher than their volatility in matched time periods without such an event, controlling for overall market volatility.
